New Records: Pat Spencer notched a new career-high with 18 points on 7-of-12 shooting from the floor in 20 minutes.
Key Match Events: Tyrese Haliburton tallied 25 points, 10 assists, three steals and two rebounds while Siakam added 25 points and nine rebounds in Indiana's 108-96.
Rookie Quinten Post made an appearance on Friday, scoring six points in seven minutes off the bench and buried his first career 3-pointer against the Pacers.
Pre-Game Insights: The Golden State Warriors didn't have much time to celebrate with the second leg of a back-to-back slated for Friday against the Indiana Pacers.
Post-Match Reflections: After a back-to-back, the Warriors will get the weekend off before traveling north for a contest with the Toronto Raptors on Monday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Former Pacer Buddy Hield helped lead the Warriors with 17 points on 6-of-19 shooting from the field with three made 3-pointers.
Friday marked Hield's third straight game with double-figure scoring numbers.
Others: The shorthanded Warriors couldn't pace Indiana's duo of Tyrese Haliburton and Pascal Siakam.
The Warriors were without multiple key veteran players, including Steph Curry, Andrew Wiggins and Draymond Green.
